attributes.action: Set up a committee to look at encouraging greater democracy, access and balance within the UK newspaper industry.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Currently our British press overwhelmingly reflects,a narrow set of views .Daily Mail,Sun,Star,Express,Telegraph and Times are similar, in terms of political views .We can see this bias,in editorial perspective,in how events are reported,and even which events are reported at all. 
Added together, the readership of these papers, make up the vast bulk of newspaper readers.This clear bias, has created an abscence of much vital  information, and of differing perspectives, which are essential, to forming a fuller worldview.
Perspective affects how members of the public form their opinions of local,national and international events.Ultimately narrow bias,is an  impediment to, an individuals or societies, necessary understanding of complex, societal and political issues.      
The Government should set up a commitee, to look at creating wider press involvement for the public,plus encourage a more representative and democratic press.
This will aid the British public in accessing a broader range of opinions,arguments and news stories.This will benefit democracy in Britain.
